oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Review of commercially available genomic technologies in cattle
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Osterstock, Jason B.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: genomics
genetic testing
accuracy
breeding value
parent verification
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Genetic testing can be a key component of a beef cattle management program. Available tests can help inform parentage, selection for simple traits like coat color or polled, management of genetic defects in breeding populations, and estimating the genetic merit of individual animals for economically relevant traits. Increasingly, comprehensive genotyping arrays that assess tens of thousands of genetic markers are being used to inform selection in cattle populations.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2019; 112-113
